items.title: 'Little more special': Colts dedicate win to Irsays
items.summary: Daniel Jones had a historic debut for the Colts, but the team's emotional rout of the Dolphins was "a little more special" on a day it honored late owner Jim Irsay.

items.title: McDaniel: Dolphins' woes in opener not all on Tua
items.summary: Tua Tagovailoa wasn't good enough in the Dolphins' season-opening 33-8 loss Sunday to the Colts, but in his defense, no Dolphins player was. "Like the rest of the team, [his performance] wasn't good enough," coach Mike McDaniel said.

items.title: Questions, takeaways off every NFL Week 1 game: Have the Colts found their QB? Is the Bengals offense doing enough?
items.summary: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 1.

items.title: Shane Steichen resurrected Daniel Jones in Colts season opener
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — For the first time since Andrew Luck’s second year in the NFL, the Indianapolis Colts start their season with a 1-0 record after besting the Miami Dolphins 33-8 at Lucas Oil Stadium. It was both an important and monumental day for the organization. Not only has the aforementioned curse finally been lifted, […]

items.title: Colts obliterate Dolphins 33-8 to snap decade-long drought in season opener
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts obliterated the Miami Dolphins 33-8 in Sunday’s season opener at Lucas Oil Stadium to snap what was the NFL’s longest Week 1 drought. Indianapolis scored on all seven possessions to become the first NFL team in at least 47 years to score on every possession of a game. The stampede sporting blue had […]

items.title: NFL Week 1 winners and losers: Aaron Rodgers gets his revenge; Dolphins crumble in Daniel Jones' Colts debut
items.summary: Which coaches, players and teams were the best (and worst) of Sunday's action?

items.title: Cam Bynum’s wild NFL celebration is actually a TikTok hit
items.summary: Cam Bynum loves a viral celebration. The safety had several creative and hilarious dances after big plays during his first four seasons with the Minnesota Vikings. As he moved to Indianapolis Colts this offseason, Bynum didn’t have to wait very long to bust out his best celebration yet. The Colts embarrassed the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, […]

items.title: Colts' Daniel Jones quiets critics by scoring on every drive of season opener vs. Dolphins
items.summary: The Colts' decision to start Jones over Anthony Richardson was controversial, but it paid off in Week 1

items.title: NFL Week 1 Recap: Indianapolis Colts 33, Miami Dolphins 8
items.summary: The Colts took down the Miami Dolphins 33–8 in Week 1, securing their first season-opening win since 2013 behind a strong debut from Daniel Jones.

items.title: Are you not entertained, Colts fans?
items.summary: The drought is finally over. Not only is the eleven year winless streak finally behind the Indianapolis Colts but they ended it convincingly by beating the brakes off the Miami Dolphins. Who knew that all it would take was Daniel Jones. After all the quarterbacks that have suited up for the season opener during this […]

items.title: Colts beat Dolphins for first season-opening win since 2013
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Colts honored late owner Jim Irsay the best way they could — with a win. They dominated the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, in the season-opener Sunday afternoon at Lucas Oil Stadium. The win is their first in week 1 since quarterback Andrew Luck led them to victory against the Oakland Raiders in 2013. [...]

items.title: Week 1 Colts vs. Dolphins Game Thread
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are at home to take on the Miami Dolphins in week 1 of the 2025 season, kickoff is at 1:00 p.m. EST. There’s a new starting quarterback in Indianapolis (I’m sure you’ve heard about it) and this will be Daniel Jones’ first crack at leading the 2025 Colts. Enough digital ink has been spilled […]

items.title: Sideline to Sideline: Jim Irsay Memories
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - Every week Blue Zone's Chris Widlic goes sideline to sideline with the Colts trying to give fans more insight to their favorite players. With Jim Irsay going into the franchise's Ring of Honor today, Chris asks players what their favorite memory is of the team's late owner.

items.title: Keys to the Game: Colts vs. Dophins
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - The Colts are looking for their first win in week one of the NFL season since Andrew Luck led the team to victory over the Oakland Raiders in 2013. IndyStar Colts insider Joel A. Erickson gives his keys to snapping that skid in today's season opener against the Miami Dolphins.

items.title: Dolphins at Colts: What to watch for
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Areas of interest as the Indianapolis Colts open the season against the Miami Dolphins Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium: Kickoff: 1 p.m. Broadcast: CBS4. Spread: Colts by 1½. History lesson, Part I The Colts will induct Jim Irsay into their Ring of Honor at halftime. The late owner established the tradition in September 1996 when he [...]

items.title: Where to Watch: Dolphins at Colts for 2025 season opener
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts (0-0) (-1.5) host the Miami Dolphins (0-0) for the 2025 regular season opener at 1 PM EST, at Lucas Oil Stadium, which the Horseshoe shockingly hasn’t won a Week 1 game since 2013. Indianapolis will be looking to snap that embarrassingly long franchise streak, and perhaps they’ll get some help from up […]

items.title: Report: Colts among teams that made initial trade inquiry to Cowboys on Micah Parsons
items.summary: According to The Athletic’s Dianna Russini, the Indianapolis Colts were among the interested initial suitors that called the Dallas Cowboys on potentially acquiring their former star pass rusher, Micah Parsons, prior to him surprisingly being traded to the Green Bay Packers last week: “About a week before the deal was finalized, word spread that the […]

items.title: Colts fans rank as least optimistic, and it’s important to understand why
items.summary: We’re number one! We’re number one! Hey, we are… The Indianapolis Colts rank dead last in an Athletic article ranking fans’ optimism heading into the season. That is a place no fan wants to be, but at least based on the people who participated in the poll, that is the reality of the situation. Should […]

items.title: Colts’ Matchups to Watch: Week 1 vs. Dolphins
items.summary: And we are now back for yet another NFL season together following our beloved Indianapolis Colts. Let me kick things off by saying that this is probably the least optimistic start of the year I have been a part of since following the team. From every single standpoint, this seems like just a wasted year […]

items.title: Indianapolis Colts Week 1 Injury Report
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts today released their Friday injury report for Week 1 of the NFL season ahead of their season finale Sunday game against the Miami Dolphins. Running back Tyler Goodson is QUESTIONABLE for Sunday’s game against the Jaguars due to a knee injury. Goodson was limited at practice all week due to the elbow injury that he […]

items.title: Daniel Jones could be a factor as Colts lean on Jonathan Taylor-led run game in '25
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The message has been the same as the Indianapolis Colts prepare to follow yet another starting quarterback into a season. Daniel Jones is the 11th different starter since Andrew Luck’s retirement prior to the 2019 season, and the sixth who’ll lead the offense into the opener. He’s cerebral, a great communicator, has command [...]

items.title: Indianapolis recalls charitable side of Jim Irsay
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS -- When the late Jim Irsay’s name is added to the Colts Ring of Honor at Lucas Oil Stadium during the team’s season opener against the Miami Dolphins on Sunday, his role as one of the leading owners of the NFL will be recalled. But more importantly, to the people and organizations of his [...]

items.title: Laiatu Latu’s impact critical to Colts’ retooled defense
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The makeover has been extensive and expensive. But whether the Indianapolis Colts are able to re-establish their defense as a formidable unit might well hinge more on a high-profile returnee than the slew of additions. That would be Laiatu Latu. General manager Chris Ballard has given first-year coordinator Lou Anarumo: The renovation of the [...]

items.title: Colts ready for gameday with new amenities, ceremony to honor Irsay
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS -- Football season is officially back in the Circle City. The Indianapolis Colts are taking on the Miami Dolphins for the 42nd regular-season home opener at Lucas Oil Stadium. As folks make their way up the stadium steps, enhanced security screening technology should improve the wait times getting in. “We're going to have better [...]

items.title: Stampede Blue Staff Roundtable: NFL season predictions
items.summary: The 2025-26 NFL season is here and members of the Stampede Blue writing team decided to come together to offer their predictions for the season. Andrew Aziz Colts Record: 7-10 Division Winners: Ravens, Bills, Texans, Chiefs | Lions, Eagles, Buccaneers, 49ers Wild-Card Spots: Bengals, Broncos, Chargers | Packers, Commanders, Rams NFL MVP: Joe Burrow Super […]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 421: Colts Look to Stop Season-Opening Trend
items.summary: In this episode of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, Dave Griffiths, Mike Chappell and Matt Adams break down the team's Week 1 showdown against the Miami Dolphins. What are the Colts' strengths and areas of concern? Can the revamped secondary keep up with Tyreek Hill and the Dolphins' playmakers? We'll explore those questions, discuss some [...]

items.title: Construction continues around Lucas Oil ahead of Colts game day
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - The Colts have their first regular-season game against the Miami Dolphins this Sunday! However, for fans attending this weekend's first game, there are several construction projects surrounding the stadium. Along with constructing the Signia Hotel and making Georgia Street pedestrian friendly, the Indianapolis Department of Metropolitan Development is working on Illinois Street and [...]

items.title: Colts’ Daniel Jones: New opportunity to go out and prove it
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — There will be spin and deflection in the coming days, but a few issues are undeniable. Issue 1 The Indianapolis Colts are Daniel Jones’ team. Shane Steichen made that clear Aug. 19. “Daniel Jones will be our starting quarterback this season,’’ he said. For the season. “I don’t want to have a quick leash [...]

items.title: Indianapolis Colts ready to kick off new season
items.summary: The countdown to kickoff is on! The Indianapolis Colts are just about ready to start their new season. Hayden Barnack, director of marketing for the Colts, joined FOX59 Morning News (with Blue!) to talk about the upcoming game and what fans can expect. Learn more here.

items.title: Jim Irsay next for Colts’ Ring of Honor: ‘He lived large in every aspect of his life’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It’s always been a vote of one. Pete Ward always came up with a short list of candidates to be considered, but in the end, Jim Irsay’s was the only voice that mattered when the discussion turned to the Indianapolis Colts’ Ring of Honor. A voice of one. “He got the final say,’’ [...]

items.title: Daniel Jones next in line as Colts look to snap 11-year winless streak in openers
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Yes, it’s been a minute. The last time the Indianapolis Colts won a season-opener, the quarterback who’ll lead them into their next season-opener was a junior at Charlotte Latin School in North Carolina who would pass for 2,398 yards and 27 touchdowns. That would be Daniel Jones, who’ll play a pivotal role in [...]

items.title: Colts signing LB Anthony Walker to practice squad
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – A former Colt is coming home. Anthony Walker Jr., a member of general manager Chris Ballard’s first draft class in 2017, has been signed to Indy’s practice squad. He went through a workout last week. Walker, 30, was a fifth-round pick in ’17 out of Northwestern who would develop from a special teams [...]

items.title: Colts giving Joe Bachie an opportunity to return to linebacker roots
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Joe Bachie’s cell phone sprang to life in early May. Opportunity was calling. First and foremost, it was an opportunity to extend and perhaps expand his NFL career. Bachie had spent four of his five seasons with the Cincinnati Bengals but was an unrestricted free agent. “I had something else lined up,’’ he [...]

items.title: Chris Ballard on benched Anthony Richardson Sr.: ‘We’re not trading him’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Despite the team’s actions to the contrary, Chris Ballard remains bullish on the 20-year-old quarterback he selected with the No. 4 overall pick in the 2023 draft. You know, the one Shane Steichen and the Indianapolis Colts have benched twice in less than 10 months. That would be Anthony Richardson Sr., now 23. [...]

items.title: Waiver claim Chad Muma boosts Colts’ LB room
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Indianapolis Colts didn’t rest once they reached the NFL-mandated 53-player limit. On Wednesday, they were awarded linebacker Chad Muma, who was waived by Jacksonville. The 6-foot-3, 239-pounder was a 2022 third-round draft pick of the Jaguars. He appeared in 50 games with seven starts. Muma is viewed as a ‘backer capable of [...]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 420: Ballard on QB Situation, Roster Cuts
items.summary: The Colts cut their roster down to 53, but the work is far from done. In this episode of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, Dave Griffiths, Mike Chappell and Matt Adams react to Chris Ballard's preseason news conference, his comments on the Daniel Jones-Anthony Richardson Sr. quarterback battle and his take on AR's future in [...]

items.title: Colts GM Chris Ballard on Daniel Jones, Anthony Richardson and the QB competition
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Indianapolis Colts general manager Chris Ballard has a point: there are 51 players on the active roster who aren’t named Daniel Jones or Anthony Richardson Sr. However, given the importance of the quarterback position, it’s no surprise Ballard found himself answering repeated questions about his team’s quarterback competition. Even then, with Jones as [...]

items.title: Previewing the upcoming Indianapolis Colts season
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts will kick off the new season in a little more than a week. Tuesday marked the deadline for cutting the preseason roster down to 53 players. Matt Taylor, radio voice of the Colts, joined FOX59 Morning News to discuss cut day and what fans can expect during the upcoming season.

items.title: JuJu Brents, Jelani Woods fail to make the cut as Colts reduce to 53 (for now)
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts have settled on their 53-player roster. For now. After waiving more than a dozen players and placing linebacker Jaylon Carlies on the injured reserve list with a designation to return Tuesday, coach Shane Steichen and his staff know what they’ve got at their disposal heading into a consequential 2025. The [...]

items.title: Colts’ cut to 53 includes LB Jaylon Carlies to IR, waiving TE Jelani Woods
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts’ process of trimming the roster includes a pair of higher-profile players. The team will place Jaylon Carlies on the injured reserve list with a designation to return and waive tight end Jelani Woods as part of its cut to 53 by 4 p.m. Tuesday, according to a source with knowledge [...]

items.title: Colts acquire cornerback Mekhi Blackmon in trade with Vikings
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Indianapolis Colts addressed their unsettled secondary by acquiring Mekhi Blackmon in a trade with the Minnesota Vikings. General manager Chris Ballard sent the Vikings a 2026 sixth-round pick to help bolster the team’s cornerback room. Blackmon, 26, was a 2023 third-round pick of the Vikings who missed last season after tearing an [...]
